Incident info: Purdy was house-sitting for someone who raises and sells pit bulls. A welfare check on Purdy found her body in the garage with evidence of a dog attack.
Dog-disposition: Several dogs were seized.
Owner info & disposition: The owner raises and sells pit bull dogs.

Incident info: Victim and his brother were searching for their small dog. When they found it, there was a pack of dogs around it. The dogs attacked the boys. One got away by jumping a fence. The other was stripped of his closed by the dogs and mauled to death.
Dog-disposition: Officials seized 6 dogs from the property. The neighbors had been complaining about loose aggressive dogs for a long time.

Incident info: Child fell through a screen and out a second story window into the yard below and was attacked by the family dogs.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized.

Incident info: The father stepped outside to move a sprinkler, got distracted by a neighbor, then heard a commotion inside. The family dogs had attacked the baby.
Dog-disposition: Seized and deemed "dangerous".

Incident info: Victim was found dead hours after an attack by four pit bull mixes.
Dog-disposition: Ten dogs were seized: three adult dogs at the scene (one which was shot by officer) and 6 puppies back at the owner's property. The four adult dogs were euthanized. One of the dogs had recently bitten a neighbor. Another of Ribera's dogs was recently killed by a neighbor after it attacked his animals. The dogs were able to escape through a hole they dug under a fence.
Owner info & disposition: Dominic Ribera was charged with possession of a dangerous dog, failure to report a death, and felony tampering with evidence. Ribera had tried to conceal the dog's escape hole, and failed to report the man's death though he had discovered it a few hours earlier.

Incident info: Victim had not returned from a walk and was found lying in a fetal position with her clothes ripped off and chunks of flesh scattered, surrounded by a pack of aggressive dogs.
Dog-disposition: The dogs owner(s) hid the dogs before animal control arrived, but they were later found locked in a building, and were seized.

Incident info: Victim was attacked in the street. The dog dragged him along the sidewalk, multiple adults tried to get the dog off, police shot the dog. Another man was bitten and injured.
Dog-disposition: Seized for quarantine
Owner info & disposition: Allegedly owned by a squatter nearby

Incident info: Victim was attacked by three dogs at a residence he was visiting. He suffered extreme injuries to his head and skull, and died several days after the attack.
Dog-disposition: Seized for quarantine

Incident info: Baby was being held by family members when the family dog jumped up and attacked the baby.
Dog-disposition: Seized for quarantine

Incident info: Boy was deceased at scene, his grandparent's house.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized

Incident info: Victim was mauled by the family dog in her backyard and pronounced dead at hospital
Dog-disposition: Unneutered male dog was seized by animal control.

Incident info: Mother and daughter were attacked in the dog's own yard as they were caring for the dogs when the owners were out of town. The daughter died from her injuries; mother is in hospital.
Dog-disposition: The dogs, Athena and Blitzen, were seized. The owners are seeking to get their dogs returned.
Owner info & disposition: Joseph and Amanda White, neighbor of the victims

Incident info: The baby was attacked when she got too close to the dog's food bowl.
The dogs breached the fencing and attacked the child and his mother in their own backyard. Two medevac helicopters were sent. The mother in critical condition; the child died.
Dog-disposition: The two dogs were shot and killed on scene by police.
Owner info & disposition: Neighbor directly behind the victim's property.
Legislation info: The prosecutor could not file criminal charges against the owner because there was no statute in NJ to do so. Legislators are drafting new laws to cover this.

Incident info: Victim attacked while walking to the corner store by neighbor's 4 dogs that escaped their property. She died of massive bleeding with bites to her face, legs, arms, back, and neck.
Dog-disposition: The dogs had previously attacked other neighbors, including a child. Montgomery County Animal Control took custody of the dogs. The dogs, identified as mixed-breed hound, shepherd, and Black Mouth Cur-type, have been euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: The dog owners were issued several citations for failure to provide proof of rabies vaccination and failure to properly confine.
Legislation info: Victim's family has legal representation. No criminal charges were filed.

Incident info: The baby died from blunt force and cranial trauma caused by the family dog.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized

Incident info: Victim was killed by a pit bull that his mother took in as a stray just a week prior. The mother was a pit bull supporter and advocate and believed the dog to be "a sweet boy".
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Mother of the victim (for one week), dumped dog prior to that.

Incident info: Victim was dead on scene at a home after trying to break up family dogs fighting.
Dog-disposition: On scene 4 adult pit bulls and 9 puppies (3 weeks old). One pit bull was surrendered for euthanasia and the puppies were surrendered. The other 3 adult dogs were returned to the owner.

Incident info: Victim tried to stop the dog attacking when two others were arguing at a house he was visiting. The dog turned on victim who sustained extensive injuries to his body.
Dog-disposition: 5-year-old pit bull terrier named Kaedo was seized.

Incident info: The teen victim was found dead in the yard.
Dog-disposition: The dog, Ully, a stud dog imported 6 months prior from Poland, was put down on site due to excessive aggression.
Owner info & disposition: Victim's moth, Jennifer Bush who operates LakeView Shepherds

Incident info: Victim was found on the side of a rural road, deceased from an attack.
Dog-disposition: Authorities are trapping for loose dogs. Trail cameras for the trapping showed a pack of dogs containing four white American bulldogs, possibly pit bull-mixes and large-mixed breeds.

Incident info: Victim was killed by the family dog while in a swing next to the bed where her parents were sleeping.
Dog-disposition: The father took the dog outside and shot it dead before responders arrived.

Incident info: As part of an assault, the dog's owner sicced his dogs on the victim. Victim had gone to his ex-girlfriend's house to pick up a cellphone he believed was there.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized by animal control. Neighbors report that these dogs have shown aggression before in public.
Owner info & disposition: Benjamin Ryan Spence has been charged with second-degree murder for directing his dogs to attack the victim. He has also been charged with assault with a dangerous weapon.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by dogs while she was out on a walk. She was already dead and dimembered when responders arrived.
Dog-disposition: 4 or 5 dogs have been caught and seized. This was a multiple-owner dog pack that was known to be aggressive and roaming.
Owner info & disposition: Multiple owners. One owner claimed to be the owner of two of the dogs. Another owner of some of the dogs had owned a bull that killed a man just 4 months prior to this dog attack.

Incident info: Victim was in a car seat when she was attacked by a dog in her residence at Schofield Barracks, suffering severe head injuries.
Victim was dead by the time responders arrived. An adult female in the same household was also injured severely in the attack.
Dog-disposition: Seized and held for 10 days, then euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was in a swing in the living room, crying, when the family dog suddenly attacked. Baby was bitten on the head; puncture wound and partial scalping. Rushed to hospital but died.
Dog-disposition: The five year old dog was euthanized after a 10-day rabies quarantine. The father said they'd had the dog all its life.

Incident info: Victim was found dead in a yard of a home.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized. The father of victim asserts they were pit bulls.
Owner info & disposition: Jeffrey Sullivan was charged with involuntary manslaughter along with three counts of possession of a dangerous animal.

Incident info: The elderly woman was attacked when she was dropped off by her daughter at her other daughter's house. The victim suffered several facial lacerations and a partially amputated leg. The other two women were also bitten, and all three women were transported to hospital.
Dog-disposition: A family member euthanized the dogs.

Incident info: The victim was attacked and killed in her home by the dog that her son had adopted only a few weeks earlier. Her son was injured trying to stop the attack.
Dog-disposition: The dog was seized by animal control and euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by two dogs in his home. The two dogs were usually kept in the laundry room when the dogs' owner, the victim's 45-year-old stepson, left the house. The stepson's wife and another adult remained shut in another room during the attack and phoned the dog's owner, who arrived home to find his stepfather dead.
Dog-disposition: Both dogs were seized.

Incident info: The child was attacked by the 7-year old family dog while in the arms of his great-grandmother.
Dog-disposition: The seven-year-old pit bull was seized.

Incident info: In an unprovoked attack, the family dog attacked the child when the adults went outside for lunch and placed the child on the ground. Two adults were injured trying to intervene in the attack.
Dog-disposition: Responders were unable to capture the dog loose in the backyard and later climbed onto the roof and shot it.

Incident info: The child was attacked in an upstairs bedroom in the middle of the night. The child's family had been visiting the household for a July 4th party and the household dogs had been confined to the basement.
Victim was still being attacked at his home by his own dog when responders arrived.
Dog-disposition: After trying pepper spray, the dog was shot to stop the attack.

Incident info: The toddler had gotten out of his enclosed yard, unnoticed, and was attacked in the street by a neighbor's dog which escaped its four-foot chain link fenced yard. The child was transported to hospital but did not survive his injuries.
Dog-disposition: The dog was seized.

Incident info: Killed after being attacked by her daughter's two pit bulls and was bitten on the arms, neck and face. At the time of the attack, Barbara was babysitting her grandson and put herself between her grandson and the dog in an attempt to protect him.
Dog-disposition: The dogs had a prior history of biting people in the household.

Incident info: The family dogs attacked the eldest family member. Two other adults tried to intervene and were also seriously injured.
Owner info & disposition: Nelson Caamano Jr., the 23 year old son and grandson of the victims.

Incident info: The infant was bitten several times by the family dog. He was flown to hospital where he later died.
Dog-disposition: The dog was seized and later euthanized at the request of the family.

Incident info: Police arrived during the attack of four dogs on an elderly woman in a yard. She was taken to hospital and pronounced dead.
Dog-disposition: One dog was killed on scene and the other three confiscated.
Owner info & disposition: The dogs belonged to the victim who was running a pit bull breeding business.

Incident info: A toddler was attacked by a dog on May 31 and mauled. He was transported to hospital and died the following day.
Dog-disposition: The dog was surrendered and later euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the two family dogs and was found deceased by her older sister on the basement floor of her home with injuries consistent with dog bites.
Dog-disposition: The victim's family stated that the two dogs were never aggressive towards anyone before. The dogs were surrendered and euthanized.

Incident info: The boy was mauled and killed by the neighbor's pit bulls when he had gone outside to check the mail.
Dog-disposition: The dogs had been aggressive in the past.
Owner info & disposition: The dog's owners were arrested. Trey Edgar Wyatt, 25, faces a felony tampering with physical evidence charge. Lisa Young, 26, faces a charge of negligent homicide, a class A misdemeanor, and a misdemeanor count of violating the Faulkner County animal ordinance.

Incident info: Victim was found unresponsive on the back patio of her home with multiple dog bite-related injuries after being attacked by her family dog.
Dog-disposition: The dog had been involved with two previous bite incidents, one of which required her boyfriend to seek medical attention after the dog bit him.

Incident info: A local doctor was found dead lying in a ditch with her car door open and engine running. She had been attacked by dogs.
Dog-disposition: Three dogs were found and seized; a fourth had been killed by a neighbor.

Incident info: Child was in a walker with family members. Family dog attacked without warning.
Dog-disposition: Surrendered and euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was attack by her own dog. Victim suffered broken bones in her arm and neck, her neck artery was mangled, she was scalped and lost both her ears. She laid for hours before being found and died four days later.
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was found dead after being attacked, and four dogs covered in blood were discovered at a nearby house.
Dog-disposition: The dogs had been the subject of several previous aggressive incident complaints. All four were euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Three people (Phyllis Jones, Kimberly Jordan, Dedricz Perry), the owners of the dogs, were indicted and arrested on reckless homicide charges.

Incident info: The elderly wheelchair-bound woman was attacked by a dog in the household which bit her arm, shoulder and neck. Her death two weeks later was listed as "mauling by canine."
Dog-disposition: The dog was held for two weeks and then euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: A man who lived in the house took in the stray dog a week prior.

Incident info: Victim was attacked and killed by his own dog after going to bed. The victim's housemate heard a loud noise and when he went to check on the noise, he found the dog biting and shaking the victim's neck. The housemate was able to wrestle the dog away from the victim; however, it was too late and the victim died from the bite wounds before paramedics arrived.
Dog-disposition: The dog had a history of aggression and was previously involved with several bite-related incidents. The dog was seized by authorities and was euthanized the next day.

Incident info: The family dog bit the child's face completely off.
Dog-disposition: The dog was surrendered to animal control.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by a pack of at least five dogs while walking near the assisted living facility where she lived.
Dog-disposition: All of the dogs were captured by animal control.
Owner info & disposition: The dogs lived on a nearby property and were not stray.

Incident info: Hamlin was attacked by the two family pit bulls in her home she shared with her son and died as a result of her injuries.
Victim was found dead outside his home with dog bites. Autopsy confirmed the cause was traumatic injuries due to a dog attack.
Dog-disposition: The three dogs were confiscated.
Owner info & disposition: The neighbors were arrested two weeks later and charged with involuntary manslaughter.

Incident info: The boy was attacked and killed by dogs up a rural hillside.
Dog-disposition: An investigation by state police led to DNA matches with several feral dogs at a nearby mine site.

Incident info: Victim was attacked and killed by a pit bull being kept on the property. An adult family member (name and relationship withheld) witnessed the attack and called 911. The dog latched onto the victim's neck and wouldn't let go.
Dog-disposition: "Thor" was seized.

Incident info: Victim died in a four-person attack where a 52 yr old woman, a 25 yr old woman and a 19 yr old man were also injured.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized on scene.

Incident info: Victim was in his front yard and had been pulled from his wheelchair by the four dogs, according to responders.
Dog-disposition: Three of the dogs were put down at the scene. One had escaped.
Owner info & disposition: The two pit bulls belonged to the victim's nephew, who lived with the victim. The other two dogs, described as mixed-breeds, were strays that hung around.
Legislation info: The nearby town had recently repealed its regulations for keeping pit bulls, wolf hybrids, dobermans, rottweilers, and guard and attack dogs.

Incident info: The family pit bull and beagle were fighting in a room where the baby was laying. The baby's teenage brother was able to separate the dogs and remove the pit bull from the room, but soon saw that the baby had been bitten.
Dog-disposition: Responders killed the pit bull, which was standing over the infant, in order to render aid.
Owner info & disposition: Family of the victim. The 38-yr-old mother, Jennifer Connell, pleaded guilty to one count of neglect of a dependent and was sentenced to one year in prison and four years of probation.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by his friend Melissa Wolke, who was seen on top of him, hitting him and commanding her dog to attack him. Responders tazed Wolke and shot the dog in order to stop the attack.
Dog-disposition: The dog was shot on scene. Wolke said the dog was a former fighting pit bull.
Owner info & disposition: Melissa Wolke was arrested for murder and other charges. She was allegedly drunk at the time of the attack.

Incident info: Victim had been sleeping on the couch with her mother. Father arrived home and found baby dead on the floor and the mother was still asleep.
Dog-disposition: A pit bull in the house was seized. There were other pit bulls kept in the back yard.

Incident info: Victim was found being attacked by dogs and was declared dead.
Dog-disposition: Authorities did not log how many dogs were involved or if they were later captured.

Incident info: The dog's owners found a dead woman and called police. Just moments before, these same dogs attacked another woman who suffered multiple bites and chunks were bitten out of her legs.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized. Neighbors say the dogs were aggressive and have been a problem for years.
Owner info & disposition: The dog's owner was taken for questioning and may face charges.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by her pet dog while she was suffering a seizure. She was pronounced dead at hospital.
Dog-disposition: The 8 year old dog had been with the family since a puppy. Had to be Tasered so responders could help the victim. Dog was seized.

Incident info: Victim was mauled by 8-10 dogs and he was found in a ditch by the local mail carrier who knew the victim but did not recognize his body. The victim's small dog was also killed in the attack. Responding law enforcement drew weapons when 8-10 dogs with blood-stained fur aggressively charged them.
Dog-disposition: 8 dogs were seized. The pack consisted of several generations of mixed breed dogs, pit bull crossed with heeler or cattle dog. All were owned by the same owner. A hearing will take place on January 3rd re destruction of the dogs.
Legislation info: McCurtain County, Oklahoma does not have a leash law and the family of the victim are pushing for stricter laws for the city of Broken Bow, Oklahoma, McCurtain County and Oklahoma State.

Incident info: Victim was attacked while walking home from school.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were shot and killed by responding police.
Owner info & disposition: Two brothers, Jacob Benevidez, 53, and Ruben Benevidez, 44, face charges of Manslaughter in the Second Degree and Cruelty to Animals.

Incident info: Victim in her mid-40's was attacked in her own yard by the neighbor's dogs that were not fenced. A week prior, the victim's family had asked the owners to contain their dogs.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were surrendered and euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: David and Vickie Clark, a neighbor of the victim, were charged with reckless conduct. In late December, the District Attorney said he would be seeking a grand jury indictment for felony involuntary manslaughter charges.

Incident info: Victim was a homeless man who went to visit his friend (the dog's owner) at a homeless encampment. She wasn't there but her dogs attacked him.
Dog-disposition: One dog was shot and killed when it charged responders. The other dog was impounded.
Owner info & disposition: Heather Anglin and Aaron Daniels were arrested on charges of failure to control a dangerous animal and involuntary manslaughter. Anglin, a homeless woman, was breeding pit bulls and has been the responsible party for several prior dog bites and attacks. Daniels and Anglin, her boyfriend, were living in a homeless encampment in the dry riverbed area along with others.

Incident info: Victim was visiting her friend when the dog attacked her. Another adult in the house tried to stop the attack including hitting it with a metal stool, but was unable to stop the attack. Victim was transported to hospital where she passed away.
Dog-disposition: The dog (Dexter) was seized and the owner (Annie Hornish) spent a year trying to save it from euthanasia. All appeals were lost and the order to euthanize was upheld in a legal decision on 12/21/2020, a year after the elderly woman's death. However, that decision was also appealed and the dog's fate is still up in the air as of January 2021.
Owner info & disposition: Annie Hornish, animal rights activist and owner of the home victim was visiting, former state rep for her state, and Connecticut Senior State Director of the Humane Society of the United States.
Legislation info: The dog's owner settled a $3.5M lawsuit from the victim's estate, and in 12/2020 still faces another lawsuit from their homeowner's insurance for lying to them about the breed of their dog. A different article from 1/2021 stated the victim's estate accepted a $2M settlement.

Incident info: Victim was found dead in her home. Autopsy revealed she was bitten to death by one or both of her two pet dogs.
Dog-disposition: Both dogs were seized.

Incident info: Victim was found by her husband on the bathroom floor, blood everywhere in the house, the dogs outside. An autopsy showed the victim died from the dog attack.
Dog-disposition: The dogs have been euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by a dog in the house. The mother attempted to stop the dog with scsissors and then a knife. Police arrived and Tasered the dog and it ran off. The victim died with a perforated neck artery and blunt force trauma to his body and neck.
Dog-disposition: The dog was recaptured after it fled the scene and was euthanized (primarily because of its injuries).
Owner info & disposition: A friend of the family. The family was housing the dog for a friend who could no longer keep it, and it was in the house for less than one day prior to the attack.

Incident info: Victim, a member of the family, was found dead in the morning where he had been sleeping on the couch.
Dog-disposition: Two pit bulls in the house have been seized, 13-year-old Beze and 5-year-old Saxon.

Incident info: Victim fell out a window into the backyard where he was mauled by the family's dogs.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized.

Incident info: Victim was mauled by three dogs in his neighborhood. He was transported to hospital and died two days later.
Dog-disposition: One dog was shot by responding police when the dog charged them. The other two dogs fled but were later found and seized. The same three dogs had attacked children on two separate occasions in the prior month.

Incident info: Victim was out back with several dogs when one attacked. A 68 yr old woman tried to intervene and was also attacked, though not seriously. Victim was transported to hospital; she died the following day.
Dog-disposition: The 92# dog, a pit bull named Chopper, was seized and will be euthanized after a 10-day quarantine. The police had been called to the home the day before for another dog bite, a different dog, but it wasn't serious and the dog remains at the residence.

Incident info: Victim was attacked in the living room of their home by the family's 9 year old pit bull.
Victim found by her husband when he returned home.
Dog-disposition: Two coonhounds were seized by animal control.

Incident info: Victim had gone over to her friend's house to pick up her purse she had left behind the night before, when the dogs attacked her. Witnesses say the dogs were tossing the victim into the air and tearing her apart. The victim jumped a small fence trying to get away from the dogs.
Dog-disposition: Responding officers shot and killed one of the dogs when it turned on them. The other four dogs were seized and euthanized. The owner said they were: a male mastiff named "Boscoe," a male rottweiler-mix named "Buddy," another mastiff-mix named "Camo," an unaltered female pit bull named "Nila" and a male, neutered mastiff-Labrador mix named "Duke." The dogs were confined only by an electric fence that was not buried, which the deputies explained was not allowed.
Owner info & disposition: Rodnee Herald, owner of the dogs and victim's landlord, told officers the dogs were just "doing their job", that they had "killed his dog", and "the dogs were family dogs".

Incident info: Victim was attacked by three loose dogs while riding her bike in an alley behind her home. Neighbors attempted to stop the attack with bricks and gunfire. The victim was rushed to hospital, but was pronounced dead.
Dog-disposition: One dog was shot and killed by a bystander. The other two dogs were seized by animal control.
Owner info & disposition: Pierre Cleveland, 33, was charged with second-degree murder, involuntary manslaughter and possessing dangerous animals causing a person's death. The victim's father said he had an argument with the dogs' owner the prior week about his flimsy fence being unable to contain the dogs. The magistrate ordered a $2 million bond with no 10 percent, exceeding the prosecution's request, because the defendant knew his dogs were dangerous, had previously attacked others, and gotten out of their fence.

Incident info: Victim had jumped a fence into a yard and was attacked by the resident dogs. Responding police also jumped the fence, got between the dogs and victim, and shot at the dogs. One police officer was bitten.
Dog-disposition: All three dogs were seized. One dog had been shot and was later euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was attacked in the street and died a short time later in hospital.
Dog-disposition: 12 dogs were picked up or trapped; 4 determined not involved. They will euthanize any which they feel were involved in this death.

Incident info: Victim had an epileptic seizure and his dog of 10 years attacked him.
Dog-disposition: The dog was seized and slated for euthanasia.

Incident info: Family dog attacked baby on the head when she was sleeping.
Dog-disposition: The 2 year old dog was seized.

Incident info: Victim had taken a shortcut through a wooded area. His body was found later that day with more than 100 dog bites.
Dog-disposition: Six dogs, all pit bull mixes, were caught in traps or picked up by law enforcement. The bite wounds matched the size of dog. DNA tests are being done to identify if the dogs they've caught were involved.

Incident info: Victim was found in a driveway by a passerby.
Dog-disposition: Three dogs were impounded.
Owner info & disposition: Daniel Kai Alexander, 29, was arrested for tampering with evidence, duty of a person, and finding or possessing a dead body. According to KSP, Alexander had knowledge of Butler's body being on McCoy Lane but never contacted police. Investigators believe he tampered with physical evidence at the scene of Butler's death.

Incident info: Victim died of "dog bite wounds of the head, neck and leg". The death was not covered by normal news media outlets but was discovered through Facebook, obituaries, and FOIA disclosures. Three months later one news report was published.
Dog-disposition: Two pit bull mixes were "family dogs" and one had bitten victim two other times in the previous six months; one incident on March 19, 2019 severed victim's ear. The larger dog was euthanized; the smaller dog returned.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the family dog in his backyard.
Dog-disposition: The dog was impounded; slated to be euthanized.

Incident info: A woman was found dead in a Costco parking lot. Area surveillance footage shows she was attacked by three dogs.
Dog-disposition: Two dogs were surrendered by a nearby business and a third, a stray, was captured. All three dogs are slated to be euthanized.

Incident info: Quick died after trying to save his 5 year old daughter from the attacking dog. Quick had bites to his juglar vein and other facial bites as well as suffering a heart attack at the scene. He could not be revived. The second adult male victim and Quick's daughter were both injured, but survived.
Dog-disposition: When responders arrived on scene, the dog was attacking a third victim, an adult male. The dog was shot and killed to stop that attack.

Incident info: Volunteer at the shelter was found dead in the exercise yard with a dog. She died of blood loss from a dog mauling.
Dog-disposition: Amos, was found as a stray a month prior and was up for adoption at the shelter. The dog was euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Humane Society of St. Lucie County

Incident info: The boy was at the property of dog trainer Scott Dunmore to take care of his dogs while he was out of town.The boy didn't return home within a reasonable time, so his grandmother called a neighbor, who found the boy mortally wounded and four dogs loose in the area.
Dog-disposition: Police seized every dog on the property. Five dogs were euthanized. The rest were returned to the owner.
Owner info & disposition: Scott Dunmore, 49, was out of town at the time.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the family dog inside the home. An adult ran out to get help and two neighbors responded. They scared the dog away with sticks and blocked it in the hallway.
Dog-disposition: The dog, named King, was seized and quarantined. The victim's grandmother said it had bitten the victim a few weeks previously, ripping his ear but the owner said it had never bitten anyone before. Neighbors say the dog had gotten loose several times before, showed aggression, and was difficult for its owner to capture and get under control. The shelter said the dog is undergoing behavioral tests.
Owner info & disposition: The dog's owners, Jack Charping, Jr., 50, and Sharon Charping, 53, were indicted on second-degree manslaughter charges. Victim's mother, 25-year-old Jennifer Geiling, was charged with reckless homicide.

Incident info: The victim was attacked by a dog belonging to a family friend and later died at the hospital.
Dog-disposition: 4 year old Rottweiler was euthanized at the owner's request.

Incident info: Was walking her own dogs behind vet office during their quarantine for a previous bite incident.
Dog-disposition: Dogs were both shot and killed by police. The dogs had previously bitten someone and were in quarantine at a vets office because the county quarantine was full.

Incident info: Baby wandered outside and loose dogs got him. Victim's grandfather stopped the attack.
Dog-disposition: Surrendered for euthanasia. The dogs had escaped by digging under their fence. Another neighbor said she reported the dogs multiple times for digging their way out.

Incident info: Mauled by his relative's dogs right outside his own home. Victim's brother called 911.
Dog-disposition: Seized. A neighbor said she reported what sounded like dog fights multiple times in the past.

Incident info: Grandmother and child went to another family house to let out the dogs. Child wandered outside while two of the dogs were out. Grandmother found dogs attacking. Tried to beat dogs with shovel.
Dog-disposition: The two attacking dogs (out of 6 pit bulls in the house under 'crate and rotate' schedules) were surrendered and will be euthanized.

Incident info: Babysitter put baby down in living room to go arrange her car for transport. Mother screams, sitter goes back inside, dog mauling baby.
Dog-disposition: Being held by Rowan County Animal Control. Shelter officials confirmed the dog has shown aggression toward people while being at the facility. The male dog is 4-years old. Euthanized.

Incident info: Victim attacked in her backyard by neighbor's dogs.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized and sent for rabies testing. Dogs's owner, White, had tried to surrender the dogs to the county shelter because he could no longer keep them secure, but was told the earliest appointment was March 1st. The dogs had previously attacked another man and killed his dog.
Owner info & disposition: Courtney White, 47, was owner of the 6 pit bulls. March 8, he was charged with a second-degree felony count of 'attack by dog'.

Incident info: Victim attacked by neighbor's dogs, ripped naked, and scalped. Her sister witnessed the attack but was powerless to intervene.
Dog-disposition: Over the years, prior incidents by these dogs had been reported to authorities.
Owner info & disposition: Neighbor. District Attorney Bryant Dunaway said the dog's owner could face homicide charges.

Incident info: Victim was playing rough with her dogs when they stopped "playing" and attacked instead. The dogs ripped off one of her arms and almost through the second. The witnesses said the victim called her dogs pit bulls and escaped by throwing herself over a fence.
Dog-disposition: Dogs seized. Neice says one of the dogs was aggressive and bit her aunt 5 times in the past, but victim would not get rid of the dog.

Incident info: Victim attacked while out walking in her neighborhood. Found in a ditch up to her shoulders in water. Victim died three days later.
Dog-disposition: Two dogs were found on scene with trace amounts of blood on their paws and mouth, however investigators were determined to include or rule out participation by coyotes and/or wolves. Subsequent DNA tests on samples taken from the victim proved the animals were at least part dog. (The style of testing only provides for information from the mother of the animal.) Further DNA testing is in progress.

Incident info: Victim was hanging laundry in her backyard, and was attacked by 3 of her neighbor's dogs on December 15, 2018. She died two months later, never having regained consciousness.
Dog-disposition: Dogs were confiscated, and euthanized on January 7, 2019.
Owner info & disposition: Neighbor Jesse Leon Miranda, 61, was arrested on an outstanding felony warrant.

Incident info: Victim was playing with ball on floor when dog entered house and attacked boy.
Dog-disposition: Dog was impounded and euthanized.

Incident info: Victim found dead in her backyard with multiple dog bite wounds, and her two trained show dogs were inside the house.
Dog-disposition: The two dogs were confiscated and are being held at BARC.

Incident info: Victim found dead next to drunk/passed-out mother.
Dog-disposition: Confiscated. Stomach contents examined.
Owner info & disposition: The mother, Breanna Henson, 30, was arrested at the scene and charged with one count of child abuse.

Reported Breed: dogs (1 Pit bull mix + 1 Shepherd mix)
Incident info: Victim attacked in his driveway by two loose dogs. Aided by neighbor, he died two weeks later.
Dog-disposition: Dogs were seized. Shelter officials are reviewing the case for a dangerous dog declaration.

Incident info: Victim attacked in her yard by 4 pit bulls owned by visitors who wouldn't leave her property with their converted school bus, 4 children and 4 pit bulls.
Dog-disposition: All 4 dogs were impounded.
Owner info & disposition: Stephanie Johnston and her husband Daniel Nelson.

Incident info: Victim was found dead in her backyard, attacked by dogs from a neighbor two houses away.
Dog-disposition: Seven mixed-breed dogs, weighing about 80 pounds each, were seized through a warrant from Grenada County Justice Court and taken into custody. They were tested by a veterinarian and later euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: The dogs belonged to a neighbor living two houses down.

Incident info: Deputies found the adult victim dead near the road. Two of the victim's grandchildren had also been attacked but were being protected by neighbors. The dogs had escaped their fenced yard.
Dog-disposition: All 4 Rotts were shot by deputies.
Owner info & disposition: Dogs were owned by the brother of the elderly victim.

Incident info: Elderly, disabled, wheelchair bound woman was found dead in her home with three pit bulls (owned by her grandson).
Dog-disposition: 3 pit bulls were seized by Newaygo County Animal Control.
Owner info & disposition: Family dog, owned by victim's grandson.

Incident info: A family dog jumped onto a bed beside its owner's newborn daughter to attack the baby in her bassinet.
Dog-disposition: Dog euthanized by Citrus County Animal Shelter.
Owner info & disposition: Family dog. No criminal charges expected.

Incident info: The toddler was attacked by the family dog at home while the parents were present.
Dog-disposition: Dog euthanized.

Incident info: Husband arrived home to discover his wife had been attacked by their dog.
Dog-disposition: Dog held at Clark County Humane Society. The victim had been bitten several times previously by the dog; family and friends said the dog had violent tendencies.
Owner info & disposition: Victim's husband was charged with first-degree wanton endangerment.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the family's dog of six years. 911 operator assisted the mother in trying to get the dog off.
Dog-disposition: Shot twice by police. Died.

Incident info: Vic alone, found by husband, died after 4 days in hospital.
Dog-disposition: Husband re-penned the dog and shot it to death with a shotgun. The male dog was one of a breeding pair the couple owned.
Owner info & disposition: Victim and husband owned the dog.

Incident info: The victim's husband left the home for a 15 minute walk. On returning, he found his wife mauled by the family dog. Victim's mother in law was present in the home, but sleeping in another room. There were no witnesses of the attack.
Dog-disposition: The dog attempted to bite responding officers. Sent to Humane Rescue Alliance, then euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Rob Frazier, victim's husband, had owned the dog for 8 years.

Incident info: Vic went into backyard to play with dog. Died on scene by a single bite to the throat.
Dog-disposition: Aggressive on scene, dog was tranquilized then euthanized on site.

Incident info: Foster-grandmother opened dog kennel. Attacked baby in her car seat on the couch.
Dog-disposition: PCAS quarantine, then euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Investigation into the delayed call to 911 (foster-grandmother/babysitter never called 911) lead to no charges.

Incident info: Susan was attacked and killed by a dog that she had recently adopted from a shelter. Her husband found her body in their home and called the police.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized at Animal Foundation at request of victim's husband.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by one or many of his six pit bulls in his home. By the time police arrived, two of the six pit bulls were dead from fighting each other.
Dog-disposition: 2 of 6 died at the scene by dog fight. The other four were impounded and euthanized.

Incident info: Elderly victim was attacked and killed by the family pit bull while sitting in her kitchen when she reached under the table to pet the dog. Her daughter was injured trying to stop the attack.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was killed in her backyard by a pit bull she had adopted just two weeks previously.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized. (Dog was previously a shelter bouncer).

Incident info: Victim was attacked and killed by her own pit bull in her home. A Rottweiler in the home was not involved.
Dog-disposition: Shot by responding officers.

Incident info: Victim had been staying at the home of the owner of the pit bull. The owner called 911 but the victim passed away before police arrived.
Dog-disposition: No information.

Incident info: Victim went for a walk. She was discovered a few hours later, deceased on the side of an unused road within the development. Two pit bulls were located with physical evidence of a recent attack.
Dog-disposition: AC quarantined 2 dogs. Owner surrendered the dogs to be euthanized and tested for rabies.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by a loose pit bull that had been kept crated in an unfenced backyard by owners who kept multiple dogs in crates.
Dog-disposition: Shot and killed by police (30 rounds discharged).

Incident info: Victim was savagely attacked by three pit bulls in the home of his babysitter.
Dog-disposition: All shot, 2 of 3 died, 1 injured.
Owner info & disposition: All five pit bulls were owned by housemate Rebecca Olan.

Incident info: Jaelah was attacked on Sunday, July 15 by a dog that her family was dog sitting and she died of her injuries several days later. The family was watching the dog while its owner was on vacation.
Dog-disposition: Removed from home, along with a second dog, a Rottweiler mix.
Owner info & disposition: Owned by a friend of the family.

Incident info: Vic and vic's son's g/f were attacked by vic's son's dog.
Dog-disposition: Euthanized, rabies neg.

Incident info: Victim was attacked and killed by one of her dogs, a Dogo Argentino that she owned with her fiance. She was found outside of her home early in the morning and died later that day. Her fiance is a K-9 officer and they owned two Dogo Argentinos (both family dogs) that were being used as a breeding pair.
Dog-disposition: Shot and killed by a responding Maryland State Police trooper. The dog had been with them for 4 years.

Incident info: The mother put the baby girl down to sleep on a bed and went out for errands, leaving her child with  her roommate. The roommate fell asleep in another part of the house. When the mother returned, the dog had mauled the infant to death.
Dog-disposition: Surrendered, euthanized.

Incident info: Infant was attacked by one of the three pit bulls while in a bouncy chair at her grandmother's house. The grandmother was in the same room at the time.
Dog-disposition: Police seized all three pit bulls from thehousehold. One was turned over to the county. No news on the other two.

Incident info: Victim's household had 4 pit bulls. Vic was taking female outside when he was attacked by 2 male 1 yr old pit bulls. Attack lasted about 20 minutes. Victim died 3 days later.
Dog-disposition: Both attacking dogs were euthanized. They had been adopted September 19, 2017 from the Henderson Animal Shelter. The owner had tried to rehome the males three months before the attack.

Incident info: Vic attacked in the yard, mother discovered.
Dog-disposition: Father stabbed attacking dog. Police shot the dog dead. The dog was a "rescued pit bull" and had belonged to the family for several years, and the family asked authorities to take away their other dog.

Incident info: Vic entered neighbor fenced yard; dogs attacked.
Dog-disposition: Surrendered dogs; euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: The neighbor, Emily Craft, was later arrested on charges of "dog at large" and "vicious animal".

Incident info: Victim was attacked by neighbor's 7 dogs.
Dog-disposition: 1 shot/killed. 6 confiscated, surrendered, euthanized.

Reported Breed: a rottweiler, labrador retriever, and small terrier
Incident info: The baby girl was attacked and killed by a family dog when her grandmother left the room to get a bottle. The family had three dogs - a Rottweiler (98 lbs), a Labrador Retriever (89 lbs), and a small terrier (10 lbs). Authorities are not sure which of the three dogs was responsible, but it is likely that one (or both) of the family's larger dogs was responsible.
Dog-disposition: AC confiscated all 3 dogs.

Incident info: Victim was killed by her own dogs. Her adult son discovered her body later.
Dog-disposition: 1 Shot/killed by adult son.

Incident info: The boy was playing in the backyard of his home when the family dog attacked and killed him. The dog was tethered at the time of the attack.
Dog-disposition: Was described as a "pit bull mix" by a family member, and as a "mixed large-breed dog" by Bexar County Animal Control who seized the dog and intends to euthanize it.

Incident info: Loxli was at babysitter Erica Jordan's home when she was attacked by her neutered male dog, which bit into the infant's skull and continued attacking as Jordan struggled to stop it and continued attacking as Jordan struggled to stop it.
Dog-disposition: Impounded, destined for euthanizing. Though the dog was described by Jordan's brother as "part pit bull, Labrador and Malamute" mix it was called a "pit bull mix" by Jordan herself on multiple occasions, including in 2016 when the same dog bit her own 6 yr old son.
Owner info & disposition: Babysitter Erica Jordan pled guilty and was sentenced to four years in prison for Involuntary Manslaughter-2nd Degree.

Incident info: 3 year old dog attacked baby in bassinet in bedroom while mother was preparing lunch in kitchen.
Dog-disposition: Confiscated, surrendered, euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Parents of the victim. No charges were filed.

Incident info: Pit attacked family beagle, couple tried to stop fight, pit attacked both adults, killed man, wounded woman and Dachshund.
Dog-disposition: Police shot the pit bull and tasered the Beagle. Beagle and dachshund rehomed.

Incident info: Child went out front to play with the doggie. Rylee was killed in her own home by a dog her family had acquired only five days earlier.
Dog-disposition: Dispatched by police on scene.

Incident info: Shelter worker cleaning cage of pit bull. was killed by the dog at a pet boarding facility, Happy Hounds Hotel, where she worked. It was the dog's first stay at the facility; its owner later said the dog had never done anything like that before.
Dog-disposition: Confiscated by Ouachita Parish Animal Control, then euthanized several days later.
Owner info & disposition: Name not released. A boarder at the kennel.

Incident info: Victim was killed by a pack of seven loose dogs of various breeds and mixed breeds while outside near the driveway of a business. The incident was captured by security cameras.
Dog-disposition: Five of the dogs were quickly located; 2 had been hit by cars, 3 were captured. Two more were trapped in the following days. A photograph of three of the dogs look like pit bull mixes. Media reported the dogs as "a variety of mix-breeds, including: doberman pinscher, German shepherd, Queensland heeler, labrador and pit bull." The remaining dogs were aggressive and expected to be euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was killed by a neighbor's two loose dogs outside her home in the early morning. The victim's husband was attacked when he went looking for his wife. His brother distracted the dogs by throwing bottles at them, which allowed the husband to retreat into the home. He shot at both dogs, killing one and wounding the other.
Dog-disposition: Victim's husband killed one of the dogs on site. The second dog was put down by the Sheriff's Dept and Animal Shelter when it returned to its home.
Owner info & disposition: Johnny Dale Lankford, 42, was sentenced to one year for "harboring a vicious animal."

Incident info: Victim was attacked at a dog boarding facility while working to rehab a dog for an Akita rescue she worked with.
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized and sent for rabies testing.

Incident info: Stephens was attacked by her two dogs while taking them for a walk in a wooded area. Her father says the dogs appeared to be "guarding" her body when he found them; deputies witnessed the dogs eating her remains.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were 2½-year-old males from the same litter, and one had been rescued by Stephens. Both have been euthanized with the family's permission.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the 6-year-old family dog on her rear deck.
Dog-disposition: The dog acted aggressively towards police officers at the scene and was shot and killed.

Incident info: Victim was killed, and another woman injured, when five dogs from her neighbor's house attacked them while walking.
Dog-disposition: Four of the dogs were ordered to be euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: The owners of five pit bulls that killed a 24-year old woman in early December have been charged with criminally negligent homicide, a misdemeanor. A Jackson County grand jury indicted Brian Keith Graden, 43, and Melody Ann Graden, 45, in connection to the death of Emily Mae Colvin. Both were booked into the Jackson County jail. In addition to the negligent homicide charge, both Gradens were charged with four counts of failure to vaccinate for rabies. The Gradens face a maximum penalty of one year in jail if they are convicted. Felony charges could not be brought against the Gradens due to insufficient state laws.
Legislation info: Emily's horrific death prompted Alabama lawmakers to pass a bill that imposes felony charges under certain conditions when a dog seriously injures or kills a person. Governor Kay Ivey signed the new legislation into law in late March. In Alabama, criminally negligent homicide is a Class A misdemeanor.

Incident info: Victim and his friend were walking in his neighborhood when they were attacked by three dogs. Korbin was pronounced dead at the scene; the other child was taken to a hospital for bites to his leg. Korbin was familiar with the dogs, played with them daily, and had just fed them before the attack. His mother was caring for the dogs while their owner was out of town and they escaped from a fence.

A woman was being attacked by four pit bulls while walking in a neighborhood. Cornelius ran out to intervene, but was instead attacked by the dogs, which belonged to her brother who lived two doors down from her. The female victim sustained serious injuries. The attack occurred on the dog owner's property, which was not fenced and contained a "Beware of dog" sign. At least one dog was contained by way of a leash. There are no ordinances requiring leashes or fences in the area.
Dog-disposition: Seven pit bulls were captured or killed by police; all but one belonged to the same owner.
Owner info & disposition: In March 2018, Doyle Simpson Patterson Jr., 47, and Amanda Dawn Albright, 40, were arrested after a grand jury indicted them on charges of manslaughter and second-degree assault. The DA said the dog mauling case went to the grand jury because the owners failed to properly contain pits bull that were known to be aggressive, resulting in a fatal attack.

Reported Breed: Pit bull and a mixed breed dog
Incident info: Victim was killed by two of his dogs in the backyard of his home. He owned three other dogs and lived alone. A 9 year old boy who lived next door attempted to stop the attack by throwing bricks at the dogs.
Dog-disposition: The two dogs, a male pit bull and a mixed-breed dog, were captured by police and taken into custody.

Incident info: The baby girl was killed by the family dog in her bedroom. The dog escaped from the kitchen area where he was fenced in, and bit the baby girl who was in a bedroom on the first floor.
Dog-disposition: The family shepherd was taken into custody.

Incident info: Victim was discovered laying dead in her driveway by her sister.
Dog-disposition: DNA tests are being performed to see if the bites match 2 pit bulls that were shot and killed after killing a horse nearby.

Incident info: Javien walked up to an enclosure to pet the two dogs, he was grabbed and dragged over the fence and into the enclosure where he was mauled. Five police officersresponded, too late to save the boy but soon enough to be traumatized by witnessing the mauling. There were about 15 witnesses, including the victim's mother and older brother.
Dog-disposition: The police tried to shoot the dogs, one jumped the fence and ran a mile before being cornered and shot "in a hail of gunfire".

Incident info: Victim was attacked by her friend's dog when she arrived at the friend's residence. A passerby tried to render aid, was bitten in the face, escaped over the top of a vehicle and called 911.
Dog-disposition: The dog was shot and killed when it approached responders aggressively. There had been complaints to animal control of an aggressive dog at the residence, and the dog had acted aggressively towards somebody at the residence the same morning.
Owner info & disposition: Dante Holloway was arrested and charged with involuntary manslaughter and reckless conduct. While being arrested at a traffic stop, deputies also found small bags in his vehicle commonly for narcotic use (one bag tested positive for methamphetamine).

Incident info: Victim was attacked by her son's dog when she went outside to feed it.
Dog-disposition: The victim's son said the dog had attacked him previously. The pit bull was euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Josh Storey, victim's son. No charges have been filed.

Incident info: Father woke up to discover his 7-year old pit bull having mauled the child. It was the first night the baby had stayed at his father's house.
Dog-disposition: The Knox County Dog Warden's Office removed two pit bulls from the residence. Both dogs were "euthanized for examination" by a court-ordered search warrant.
Owner info & disposition: Teddy Hagans: Knox County Prosecutor declined to file any charges.

Incident info: Victim was found by the next door neighbor in victim's fenced backyard along with the two dogs.
Dog-disposition: 6-year old male American bulldog, named Max, and a 9-year old female pit bull, named Holly. Both dogs were put down and tested negative for rabies.
Owner info & disposition: Family dogs. Officially registered to victim's mother-in-law (same residence).

Incident info: Victim was killed by one of her daughter's and son-in-law's pit bulls that she was tending while the owners were out of town. She had brought her own Dachshund to the house that day to tend the pit bulls. A pit bull attacked the Dachshund and victim was mortally wounded attempting to break up the fight. Victim was able to crawl to a phone and place a call before passing out.
Dog-disposition: The attacking dog was seized.

Reported Breed: dogs (1 Giant Schnauzer mix + 1 Labrador Retriever mix)
Incident info: The parents had stepped away and the dogs opened the door to the bedroom where the baby boy slept in a bassinet.
Dog-disposition: The two male family dogs, a giant schnauzer and labrador both named Jack, were surrendered to BARC, Houston's animal control agency. It could not be determine which of the dogs attacked the infant, so both dogs were euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Victim's parents. No charges were filed.

Incident info: The parents, child and dog were sleeping together in a room while visiting relatives. The parents woke up to find the dog attacking the baby. Victim died 8 days after being attacked.
Dog-disposition: The dog was to be euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Victim's parents. No charges were to be filed.

Incident info: Grandmother and her young grandson were bowled over by two of their pit bulls which then attacked the child. Grandmother and mother were breeding the pit bulls and had previously been cited multiple times for disorderly animals. Instead of calling 911, the grandmother drove the baby to her daughter's house, and from there to a urgent care facility where the victim was pronounced dead.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were confiscated, were to be observed for 24-48 hours, then euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Sandra Adams, 70, was charged with second-degree murder, second-degree cruelty to children and involuntary manslaughter. In March 2018, Sandra Adams pleaded guilty to involuntary manslaughter and was sentenced to 10 years probation. During 2013-2015, Adams had been cited at least six times about these same two pit bulls running at large and being aggressive.

Incident info: Victim's mother left the child unattended in an enclosed tampoline. The boy got out of the enclosure and was mauled by one or more of the four family dogs roaming in the backyard.
Dog-disposition: Animal control seized four dogs involved in the attack, described as one pit bull and three shepherd-mixes. Neighbors said the family's dogs were aggressive and had escaped their property before.
Owner info & disposition: On September 29, 2017 authorities arrested and charged the victim's parents, Brittany Brooks, 27, and Ashley Brooks, 29, with felony Injury to a Child.

Incident info: Victim let out his pit bull and it ran off his property and attacked another pit bull being walked on leash. Victim tried to break up the ensuing fight but was bitten near his recently installed dialysis shunt, causing profuse bleeding. The attacked dog was badly mangled.
Dog-disposition: The Seneca County Dog Warden took Parks' pit bull, named Mia, into custody.

Incident info: Victim died outside a wrecker tow yard when he arrived to visit the owner, who was not there. Camera footage showed the dogs which attacked him.
Dog-disposition: A neighbor shot 2 dogs, police shot a third, and the fourth ran off. All of the dogs were euthanized and sent for rabies testing.
Owner info & disposition: Mike Stephens, owner of Stephens Towing and Wrecker Service.

Reported Breed: dogs (1 pit bull + 1 pit bull mix)
Incident info: Victim was working in her yard when the tenant's children exited the house with the dogs. Victim was attacked and passed away three days later. Victim was on life support for several days to await rabies test results so organ donation could proceed.
Dog-disposition: Bane, a 6-year old male pit bull and Kitty, a 13-year old female pit bull-mix -- were surrendered and put down, allowing the rabies tests to proceed. Neither dog had been vaccinated for rabies.
Owner info & disposition: Wayne Bartlett, the tenant, pleaded guilty to harboring vicious and dangerous dogs and failing to have rabies vaccinations, and was ordered to pay $15,500 in restitution to the victim's family.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the family dog while her grandmother was doing laundry and opened a door which allowed the dog access to the baby. The dog took the baby outside and the grandmother was unable to stop the attack. An officer shot the dog, injuring it.
Dog-disposition: The father had owned the male Rottweiler for 3 years. The dog was shot and injured on site, was impounded, and later euthanized.

Incident info: The dog had been adopted just hours before from a rescue, wearing a shock collar. The victim's daughter removed the shock collar and the dog pounced. The daughter hit the dog with a hammer and a cast iron skillet, to no avail. The victim was gutted and had an arm amputated before fatally succumbing to her injuries.
Dog-disposition: Male pit bull, neutered, 1.5 years, had a long bite history and had been sent for training/rehabilitation for 2-3 months, but it didn't work. He had been imported from New York state. He was adopted out two more times, and returned, before being adopted to the victim's family.
Owner info & disposition: Jamie Cochran, the 33-year old owner of Forever Home Rescue and Rehabilitation Center, was been charged with 10 misdemeanors for importing animals without a veterinary inspection certificate, according to the Virginia Commonwealth Attorney’s Office. More charges may follow once the investigation is complete. The rescue was known for obtaining violent dogs from kill-shelters and rehoming them in mere hours.
Legislation info: Because of this death, Virginia passed a law requiring disclosure of a dog's bite history upon adoption.

Incident info: Victim was left alone in a bouncy chair "for five minutes" with three pit bulls loose in the house.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were euthanized. All three dogs had been adopted by this family as rescues.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by her own dog in her home.
Dog-disposition: The dog had been living in the victim's home for six years.

Incident info: Victim was playing in a baby walker when the mother went to the bathroom. Upon returning, she found her pet dog of nine years biting the baby.
Dog-disposition: The male pit bull, named Mana, had been with the family for nine years. The dog was euthanized.

Incident info: Victim was found dead in her house with injuries that are consistent with a dog attack. She was found dead by her daughter who said one dog was "extremely aggressive".
Dog-disposition: The most aggressive dog, Moyo, was dispatched on site to allow responders to reach the victim. Another seven Boerbols were seized and euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Victim, who was a breeder and seller of Boerbols.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by her own dog on her second-floor deck. A neighbor heard her scream for help and unsuccessfully attempted to intervene by hitting the dog with a ham bone and poking it with a wooden board. Eventually an off-duty police officer living nearby shot the dog, ending the attack. Green died in the hospital.
Dog-disposition: The dog was shot by a neighbor, an off-duty police officer, then later euthanized. Victim owned the 3.5-year old dog, named Leon, for about two-and-a-half years. Two years earlier, victim's dog attacked another neighbor's Husky. Another man's grandson had been bitten in the face by the same dog several years ago, but it had not been reported, so the dog was never placed on the state's dangerous dog list.

Incident info: Victim was walking in an alley when he was attacked by a dog that had broken from its chain. Police arrived during the attack and killed the dog. The victim was still alive when two police officers arrived, but they delayed checking on the victim for nine minutes and he died from blood loss.
Dog-disposition: The attacking dog was shot and killed, and three other pit bulls were confiscated. One was adopted out and two were euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: 16 months later, Anthony D. Austin, 29, was convicted of a first-degree misdemeanor charge of failing to control his dog, and was sentenced to 100 days in jail, five years probation, and a prohibition against keeping any dogs. The police chief apologized in court for the actions of his officers in delaying assistance to the victim.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by two dogs that escaped a neighbor's fenced yard while she was walking her own dog in her neighborhood. The victim was nearly decapitated. First responders were initially unable to help the victim so police officers fired on both dogs, killing one, and rammed the other with a vehicle.
Dog-disposition: One pit bull survived and was taken into custody where it was to be held as evidence in the homicide investigation. The dogs belonged to a neighbor who lived about a block away. Animal control had received complaints about the dogs before. Neighbors had also issued their own warnings about these dogs. After a photograph of the dogs emerged from social media, there was confusion over the breed of the large white dog, an XXL pit bull or American bully, both are designer pit bull breeds.
Owner info & disposition: Antwon Demetris Burks, 31, was charged with second-degree manslaughter on May 10, 2017.

Incident info: The family dog attacked the victim, unprovoked, while under the care of a babysitter. Police arrived while the attack was still underway and shot/killed the dog. Victim's name was only mentioned in a GoFundMe post linked from various news articles.
Dog-disposition: The 65# pit bull was 6-8 years old and the family had owned it since a puppy.

Incident info: A neighbor's two male pit bulls attacked victim's Pomeranian, killing it. When the victim tried to intervene, the pit bulls knocked him down then mauled him. A witness said the owner watched the attack yet made no motions to help the victim. Victim died after three weeks in a coma, never regaining consciousness.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were seized and labelled dangerous. Later the owner tried to reclaim his dogs. The dogs had previously killed another dog and the neighbors were in fear of the dogs.

Incident info: Victim was bitten on the neck by one of the three dogs owned by roommate and cousin, Talburt. Talburt grabbed the dog and put him in his kennel in his bedroom. With no defensive wounds, and a history of seizures, it was determined that the victim was probably in the middle of a seizure at the time of the attack.
Dog-disposition: Hercules, the male pit bull that inflicted the attack  (one of three pit bulls in the residence), had bitten three people before delivering a bite that killed Jamie Owsley. Hercules was euthanized on March 7, 2018.
Owner info & disposition: Kerry Talburt II, 22 years old. Five months later Talburt attacked another man and allowed his dogs to bite that man in the face. Talburt was also accused of pushing his thumb in one of the man's eyes. At that time, Talburt was charged with six felonies: home invasion, aggravated battery, reckless conduct, criminal trespass of a residence and two counts of obstructing justice. Talburt was sentenced to fifteen years in a plea deal for the second attack and a slew of related charges. The judge assigned three years to the 2017 aggravated battery charge. Talburt was also ordered to pay $13,476 in restitution.

Incident info: The child was attacked by two family dogs. The identity of the child was not publicly reported.
Dog-disposition: The two dogs, both English mastiffs, were 6-months old.

Incident info: Victim was attacked by the family dog in the basement of her home, where she kept dogs. The dog also bit her 39-year old autistic son, who managed to escape to a neighbor's home to get help.
Dog-disposition: The male dog, Boss, was adopted 6-years earlier from Animal Care and Control when the dog was about a year old. Two weeks before attacking its owner, Boss killed a small terrier in the neighborhood. Hermida had been planning to return the dog to the shelter because it was too aggressive and uncontrollable, but did not act soon enough. Family members said Hermida was trying to break up a fight between Boss and another dog when Boss attacked. Neighbors said the family kept up to ten dogs in the basement of their home.

Reported Breed: dogs (1 pit bull + 1 pit bull mix)
Incident info: Three children were attacked by two dogs on their way to the school bus stop. Some kids ran to pull the dogs off and neighbors intervened to rescue the children. The six year old died, a five year old girl was gravely injured and an older child got away with minor injuries.
Dog-disposition: One dog was shot and later captured. The second dog was also seized.
Owner info & disposition: Cameron Tucker, 31, was arrested and charged with two counts of misdemeanor reckless conduct, and later, one count of felony involuntary manslaughter. A judge later reduced the charges to misdemeanor manslaughter.

Incident info: The baby girl was attacked by the family dog while the father was sleeping. The baby had been napping in an infant bouncer next to him on the couch, but was on the floor and cold to the touch when he awoke. The baby's mother was at work at the time.
Dog-disposition: The family had owned the male dog for more than 8-years and had raised the dog since it was a puppy.

Incident info: The dog attacked an elderly woman and Fear was killed by the dog when he tried to intervene to stop the attack. The dog had escaped the owner's property. The woman survived the attack.
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized. The dog was a failed police K-9 that officer Alex Geiger purchased with intent to use as a police K-9 in his new job at a different police agency that didn't already have a K-9 unit.
Owner info & disposition: The dog's owner, former officer Alex Geiger, was acquitted at trial for involuntary manslaughter and failing to maintain control of a dangerous animal resulting in injury or death.

Incident info: The victim was playing a video game when the family dog attacked him unprovoked. There were two adults in the room at the time.
Dog-disposition: The attacking dog, a 3 yr old unneutered male pit bull, had been living in the house for about a year. There was a second pit bull, a female, in the house that was not involved with the attack. Both dogs were seized. The city filed a motion to euthanize the attacking dog.
Owner info & disposition: Live-in boyfriend of the victim's mother.

Incident info: Victim was killed in her home by her daughter's two dogs. The dogs were being kept in the basement and the daughter told her mother not to go down there.
Dog-disposition: Panda and Jacob were seized and euthanized. Animal control labelled the dogs as "Am Pit Bull Ter Mix" and posted their photos. The two dogs were even x-rayed to determine stomach contents.
Owner info & disposition: The daughter of the victim, who later blamed her mother for her own death.

Incident info: Child was killed by 3 year old dog they had purchased minutes earlier. The mother tried to intervene, but was unable to stop the attack and was injured. The previous owner had delivered the dog and stayed for 30-45 minutes as they got acquainted with the dog. Five minutes after leaving, the previous owner was called back. He arrived with the attack in progress. The child died on scene.
Dog-disposition: The dog was later scheduled to be euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: The victim's mother. The previous owner was not charged and wasn't named in media reports.

Incident info: The father, recently out of prison and newly received custody of his young daughter, fell asleep with the child in front of the TV. Later woken by his housemate to "Where is Piper?" Unable to find the child, they called 911. Police found the child dead in the front yard where the pit bulls had dragged her and killed her.
Dog-disposition: The two dogs belonged to a woman who was staying with the victim's father. They tried once to rehome the dogs, but that lasted an hour before the new owner called to say come pick up the dogs. They did.
Owner info & disposition: Margaret Jaramillo, a woman staying with the victim's father. The mother sued Child Protective Services and the contracted foster agency for moving the child back into the father's home after previously removing the child from there.

Incident info: Child died of an animal attack, including punctures and lacerations through skull.
Dog-disposition: Unknown.

Incident info: Victim was attacked in the face by her son's dogs. He tried to pull the dogs off, and was also bitten. Victim died on scene.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were euthanized the following day by permission from the owner.
Owner info & disposition: Richard Shawl, 36, son of victim who also shared victim's home.

Incident info: Victim was taking trash to the dumpster at the apartment where he lived when he was attacked by four dogs that had escaped through a hole in the fence from the adjoining property. The dogs dragged his body back through the hole in the fence and dismembered him in their own back yard.
Dog-disposition: The two younger 3-year old dogs were offspring of the two older dogs. They were reputedly mixes of Rottweiler, German Shepherd and Chow.
Owner info & disposition: Lephus Felton, the dogs' owner, blamed the victim, theorizing that he had teased the dogs. The dogs' owner was not at home at the time of the attack. The Jacksonville Sheriff's Office was working with the State Attorney's Office to determine if criminal charges would be brought against Felton.

Incident info: Victim and his friends had gone to their friend's house for some candy. When the front door was opened, the dog attacked, biting the victim in the face, head and neck.
Dog-disposition: 3 year old "Left Eye" was euthanized after being surrendered by its owners. A month earlier, the same dog had killed another dog in the neighborhood. Animal Control did not declare the dog dangerous or vicious at that time. The neighbors also said the dog had attacked another child.

Incident info: Victim was mauled by a dog in her home while the dog's owner, her boyfriend, was at work.
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized by the owner. There were four pit bulls in the household. This one was said to have been raised in the house since a puppy and was now 95 pounds.
Owner info & disposition: Devin Bannon, boyfriend and housemate of the victim.

Incident info: The homeless victim was mauled to death by two dogs, loose from a nearby business, while washing his clothes in a stream.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were returned to the owners despite nearby businesses and residents saying the dogs had gotten out before and been involved in previous attacks.
Owner info & disposition: Michael Souza and Candace Souza, owners of the business ContainerLand where the dogs resided.

Incident info: Victim was found dead in her home by her daughter. There were four pit bulls in the home and it is unknown whether one or more of the dogs were involved in the attack. The victim was knocked down then attacked in the throat, severing her jugular vein.
Dog-disposition: Animal control removed all four dogs.
Owner info & disposition: Per family members: The pit bulls belonged to Rivera's daughter and her daughter's boyfriend. Several years ago, Rivera was severely bitten in the face by a different pit bull owned by the same couple. Rivera underwent extensive surgeries and skin grafts after the earlier attack. That pit bull was put down.

Incident info: The victim's aunt went out to get the cattle and, unknowingly, her young nephew followed her. She saw a pack of the neighbor's dogs gathering and went over to see what it was, then found the child.
Dog-disposition: Two dogs were shot on scene and three were taken into custody and euthanized at an animal shelter in Fort Defiance AZ. All five dogs tested negative for rabies. Others had reported these dogs before for aggression and attacking livestock, but no action was taken until the boy was killed.

Incident info: Victim was attacked, bitten and mauled by two dogs when she and her friend were walking up to his house. During the attack, the owner tried to pull the dogs off the victim, but he was also attacked and suffered non-life threatening injuries. Neighbors also intervened by throwing rocks at the dogs during the incident. After the attack, victim underwent surgeries to remove both eyes and one leg. Victim had been in a medically-induced coma since the attack and doctors removed her from life support one week later.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were surrendered for euthanasia.
Owner info & disposition: Dr. Hamilton Hicks, 37, was arrested on drug possession charges, but no charges were filed in relation to the attack.

Incident info: The mother left her infant propped with pillow on the sofa to go to the bathroom. Her brother's two male dogs, which she thought were tied up outside, entered through an open door, and attacked the infant, dragging the baby outside. The uncle arrived home and found the dogs attacking the baby and yelled and screamed.
Dog-disposition: The dogs were surrendered to the Central California SPCA to be euthanized. One had a history of aggression.

Incident info: The victim, a process server, had entered a gate to a property to serve court papers, leaving her car running, and was attacked by several dogs. Her body was found when neighbors investigated her car by the unlatched gate.
Dog-disposition: No humans lived at the house, where the six adult dogs were kept for breeding purposes. A court ruled to euthanize the six adult dogs. Terry Swanson, vowed to appeal the decision. They were described as four labrador-mixes and two Australian cattle dog-mixes. 14 puppies were also found on the property.
Owner info & disposition: Terry Swanson and his uncle, Robert McCray, and McCray’s wife, Marjorie Kalinec, have been the primary caretakers of the dogs. McCray is the person who discovered McCleskey's body. The dogs' owners blamed the victim for her own death during the hearing, saying that McCleskey failed to heed a no trespassing sign. Justice Herb Evans remarked: "She didn’t deserve to die, and these animals don’t have a license to kill."

Incident info: Victim was helping the dog's owner repair a scooter in the friend's fenced front yard. They'd gone inside and the dog had sat on the victim's lap. They went to get up to go outside and the owner told the dog to get off Earl and it attacked him. The owner and his wife were unable to get the dog off the victim.
Dog-disposition: When deputies arrived, they found the dog "Harley" in the yard still aggressive. They shot and killed that pit bull. Two younger offspring pit bulls also participated in the attack and were eventually pulled away, and they were seized by authorities.

Incident info: While visiting with his father, victim was playing outside with two other children when the dog attacked the boy. Report states the attack was unprovoked, and the dog had a history of attacking other pets belonging to its previous owner. The father was living in a camper on the dog owner's property.
Dog-disposition: The dog was euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Gary Merchant Jr. Previously, Merchant's step daughter returned this same dog to the Merchants in early 2016 after it attacked another dog in her home multiple times. There were 8 dogs on Merchant's property at the time. The Merchants were breeding and selling pit bulls and other breeds of dogs.

Incident info: Victim was discovered dead inside his home by relatives who hadn't heard from him in a few days. One of the victim's two pit bulls was acting aggressively and was shot by authorities inside the home; the other pit bull was taken into custody.
Dog-disposition: Milow was loose in the house behaving extremely aggressive. Police shot and killed the pit bull because police and animal control could not control it. Another dog in the house, a female German shepherd-mix, was taken into custody without incident.

Reported Breed: dogs (4 pit bull mixes, 3 other breed mixes)
Incident info: Victim was attacked in a vacant lot by a pack of dogs belonging to a local resident who had a history of repeated citations for violating dog ordinances and surrendering of dogs. Doctors placed her into a medically induced coma. She died seven days later after being removed from life support.
Dog-disposition: Two days after the attack, police responded to a separate 911 call of a man being attacked by three pit bulls at the same location where Brown was attacked. The arriving officer, who also responded to Brown's attack, relayed to 311 they were the same dogs, setting off seizure proceedings. Six dogs were seized from 3307 Spring Avenue on May 6 and another on May 9. The seven dogs were quarantined for 10 days, assessed unadoptable, and euthanized.
Owner info & disposition: Maria Cardoso was a habitual violator of loose and aggressive dogs. From 2013 to 2015, Cardoso surrendered 21 dogs for violations, including attacks.
